data.title: Economic diversity and student outcomes at Whitworth
data.meta_description: See how Whitworth compares to more than 2,000 American colleges.
data.text:
The median family income of a student from Whitworth is $108,600, and 46% come from the top 20 percent. Less than 1% of students at Whitworth came from a poor family but became a rich adult.

A new study, based on millions of anonymous tax records, shows that some colleges are even more economically segregated than previously understood, while others are associated with income mobility.

Below, estimates of how Whitworth compares with its peer schools in economic diversity and student outcomes.
